  Claim

   Static electricity is the cause of an increase in gas station refueling
   fires.

What's False

   Static electricity has not definitively been identified as the cause of a
   number of gas station refueling fires.

The summary appearing on the PEI site states that “To date over 150
       refueling fires have been documented that appear to be caused by a
       discharge of static electricity”; it does not say data from those 150
       fires were used in preparing the summary (and it includes information
       about only 81 gas station fire incident reports).

News reports of gas station fires caused by static electricity are a mixed
   bag of claims, warnings, and skepticism.
